alert.note: Alert for Autauga; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 10:42AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Autauga and central Montgomery Counties through 1115 AM CDT... At 1041 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Autauga County Airport to Snowdoun to near Pike Road. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Montgomery, Prattville, Pike Road, Montgomery Zoo, Boylston, Hyundai Motors Of Alabama, Auburn University In Montgomery, Woodcrest, Maxwell Air Force Base, Snowdoun, Lagoon Park, Hunter, Alabama State University, Hope Hull, Dannelly Field, Eastdale Mall, Mount Meigs, Montgomery Riverwalk Stadium, Pinedale and Gunter Air Force Base. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for central, south central, southeastern and east central Alabama.
